label: 延年舞
本: The Seven Tengu Scrolls: Evil and the Rhetoric of Legitimacy in Medieval Japanese Buddhism . University of Hawai'i Press . 2012
説明文: Ritual dance. Ennen were staged spontaneously by shuto who attended services or religious ceremonies. High-ranking monks often objected to the staging of ennen; in response, shuto would rise in protest, conduct a sengi, and push ahead with the performance.
